display.name: OMG Network
display.description: OMG Network claims to be the leading value transfer network for ETH and ERC20 tokens. The Network scales by centralizing transaction processing and remains safe by decentralizing security.

layer.description: The data is not posted to any data availability layer.

bridge.description: Data is not posted to Ethereum but to a plasma chain. There is a guarantee that if data is unavailable you can still exit using latest available state root.

stateValidation.description: Exits from the network are subject to a period when they can be challenged. The internal network state is left unchecked.

dataAvailability.description: Proof construction and state derivation rely fully on data that is NOT published onchain.

exitWindow.description: There is no window for users to exit in case of an unwanted regular upgrade since contracts are instantly upgradable.

sequencerFailure.description: Users can force the sequencer to include a withdrawal transaction by submitting a request through L1. If the sequencer censors or is down for , users can use the exit hatch to withdraw their funds.

proposerFailure.description: Users are able to trustlessly exit by submitting a Merkle proof of funds. The details are unknown.

categories.title: Fraud proofs
categories.description: The internal system state is not subject to any checks. Only exits from the system can be challenged. This places a much higher burden on potential validators, as they have to monitor all user activity and not only the single state.

risks.text: there are fraudulent exits which nobody reported. Fraud proofs assume that every exit is checked by at least one honest and able party.

dataAvailability.name: Data is not stored on chain
dataAvailability.description: The transaction data is stored on a plasma chain and is not recorded on the Ethereum main chain.

operator.name: The system has a centralized operator
operator.description: The operator is the only entity that can propose blocks. A live and trustworthy operator is vital to the health of the system.

risks.text: the operator exploits their centralized position and frontruns user transactions.

forceTransactions.name: Users can independently exit the system
forceTransactions.description: Independent exit allows the users to escape censorship by withdrawing their funds. The system allows users to  withdraw their funds by submitting a transaction directly to the contract onchain.

risks.text: the operator refuses to include their transactions. However, there exists a mechanism to independently exit the system.

exitMechanisms.name: Regular exit
exitMechanisms.description: The user executes the withdrawal by submitting a transaction on L1 that requires a merkle proof of funds.

massExit.name: The mass exit problem is unsolved
massExit.description: In case the operator is malicious all users need to exit within a predetermined time frame. Users that do not manage to do this will lose their funds.

risks.text: users are unable to withdraw in a mass exit event.

ethereum.name: PaymentExitGame
ethereum.description: The source code of the PaymentStartStandardExit library used by this contract is not verified on Etherscan.
